column4: Anyone know the path to the trash bin (gnome trash bin)  some things in there will not delete and it shows as full - permission issue it seems
Do you know if that is a know bug?
do i know if what is a known bug? sorry, i'm not following
it looks to be a bug.  That trash cannot be deleted  in gnome
can you paste to a pastebin the contents of this command?   cd ~/.local/share/Trash;  ls -ld *
you probably deleted something using sudo or using nautilus under sudo
I actually restored some content from a DVD and it had the wrong permissions and got "stuck" in the trash bin.  Shouldn't the normal behavior be that it is deletable. =)
well, you shouldn't be able to delete files in directories that you don't own
this is not a bug -- it's just how unix/linux is
Its files I restored from backup DVD!
It would be great if it wared you or told you what one might do to solve the problem. =)
the files probably had permissions set on them -- i dunno, anyway, you got your thing resolved
perhaps -- but then it is obvious if you get a permissions denied message :)
I figured it out because this is the second time I see the issue
